paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant V30M, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.phenotype: Hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis (ATTRv) with neuropathic symptoms

individual_records.evidence_sentence: All patients had a positive V30M mutation.
All patients had a positive V30M mutation.
Both early-onset patients and three of the late-onset patients had normal sensory- and motor NCS bilaterally.
Both early-onset patients and three of the late-onset patients had normal sensory- and motor NCS bilaterally.

functional_data.summary: The V30M mutation in TTR is associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis, leading to neuropathic symptoms.

variants.segregation_data: The V30M variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The study included both early and late-onset patients.
key_quotes: All patients had a positive V30M mutation.
Two patients had early-onset of disease and eleven presented with late onset of symptoms.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text.
